events.event_description: U.S. fuel ethanol exports hit record levels, averaging 121,000 barrels per day in the first eight months of 2024.
events.citation: In the first eight months of 2024, U.S. fuel ethanol exports averaged 121,000 barrels per day (b/d)—the most fuel ethanol exports in the first eight months of any year.

events.event_description: UK government passed E10 standard leading to increased fuel ethanol consumption in the country.
events.citation: Fuel ethanol consumption has been increasing in the United Kingdom since the UK government passed an E10 standard in September 2021.

events.event_description: Colombia reintroduced E10 mandate amid reduced domestic ethanol production.
events.citation: Colombia remains the fourth-largest destination for U.S. fuel ethanol exports, and this year's increase is mostly attributable to the reintroduction of an E10 mandate and reduced domestic ethanol production.

events.event_description: U.S. fuel ethanol production reached a record high in July 2024, driven by increased production capacity and low input prices.
events.citation: Fuel ethanol production hit a record high in July and is on track for its highest annual level since 2018 because of increased production capacity and low input prices.

events.event_description: U.S. Gulf Coast fuel ethanol prices dropped 25% from 2023 levels, reaching lowest point since 2020.
events.citation: The annual average price in 2024 of fuel ethanol on the U.S. Gulf Coast, from where most U.S. fuel ethanol exports depart, has fallen about 25% from 2023 and is its lowest since 2020.

events.event_description: India's fuel ethanol imports from U.S. rebounded to record volumes in 2024 due to reduced domestic sugarcane and rice production.
events.citation: After decreasing in 2022 and 2023 due to increasing supply chain costs and elevated U.S. fuel ethanol prices, U.S. fuel ethanol exports to India have rebounded to record volumes in 2024, slightly exceeding the highs from 2017 to 2020.
